page.title: 20THE DIVIDED VILLAGE
page.content: Do tensions and divisions lie beneath a tranquil surface? On one side the old village folk,wanting continuance of traditional village life,they went to the village school and work locally. On the other side,wealthy newcomers,paying inflated house prices which are beyond the reach of local youngsters. Some newcomers work away from the locality, do not use the Village School,are drawn to the country as a peaceful retreat from the frenzy of urban life. The attitudes of these to village life is very different from those whose families originated here and deep rooted sensitivities can be ignored. Financial status or success emerge as the measure by which people are judged and valued. Is this the true way of a country village?
